com.kinvey.persistence
Class CachedStore

java.lang.Object
  com.kinvey.persistence.CachedStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
AppdataStore
public class CachedStore
extends Object
implements AppdataStore

This application data store caches query results, depending on the policy. Policy.CACHE_FIRST policy is the default.

Usage

The CachedStore must is backed by a MappedAppdata collection and MappedEntity class. 

 MappedAppdata mMappedAppdata = mKcsClient.mappeddata("itemCollectionName");
 AppdataStore mCachedStore = mKcsClient.cacheddata(mMappedAppdata, ItemEntity.class);
 
 SimpleQuery q = new SimpleQuery();
 q.addCriteria("field1", "==", "value1");
 mCachedStore.query(q, new ListCallback() {
     public void onFailure(Throwable t) {
         showAlert(t.getMessage());
     }
 
     public void onSuccess(List itemEntities) {
         mItemEntities = itemEntities;
     }
 
 });

Caching policies

There are a few policies that can change the way the caching mechanism operates.

  • Policy.NO_CACHE - No caching, all queries are sent to the server.
  • Policy.CACHE_ONLY - Only the cache is queried, the server is never called. If a result is not in the cache, an error is returned.
  • Policy.CACHE_FIRST - The cache is queried and if the result is stored, onSuccess is called with that value. The cache is then updated in the background. If the cache does not contain a result for the query, then the server is queried first.
  • Policy.NETWORK_FIRST - The network is queried and the cache is updated with each result. The cached value is only returned when the network is unavailable.
  • Policy.BOTH - If available, the cached value is returned in onSuccess. The network is then queried and cache updated, afterwards. onSuccess will be called again with the updated result from the server.

Author:
t0m

Constructor Detail

CachedStore

public CachedStore(MappedAppdata backedBy,
                   Class<? extends MappedEntity> mappedClazz)
Construct a new CacheStore with a mapped appdata and mapped class definition. Uses the default caching policy Policy.CACHE_FIRST

Parameters:
backedBy - the collection object from which to cache
mappedClazz - the class type of MappedEntity for which to perform the mapping, default constructor must be enabled for this to work

Parameters:
backedBy - the collection object from which to cache
mappedClazz - the class type of MappedEntity for which to perform the mapping, default constructor must be enabled for this to work
policy - the caching strategy to use

save

public <T> T save(MappedEntity instance)
       throws KinveyException
Create or updates the object. Used in special cases where the calling code would like to run the network request in its own thread. Saves the current state of the mapped class to kinvey data storage.

Warning: network requests should be run using a background thread, look at using save(MappedEntity, ScalarCallback) instead.

Specified by:
save in interface AppdataStore
Parameters:
instance - the instance of the class to perform the mapping during save
Throws:
KinveyException

Type Parameters:

Parameters:

query

public <T> List<T> query(Query query)
              throws KinveyException

Queries the mapped data for all entity that match.

Depending on the policy set this could make a network call or just hit the local cache.

Warning: this method will make network calls when policy is set to BOTH or NETWORK_FIRST; to avoid running on UI thread use query(Query, ListCallback) asynchronous version.

Specified by:
query in interface AppdataStore
Parameters:
query - a simple query object specifying the conditions
Returns:
list of results returend by the query
Throws:
KinveyException - in the event an error occurs

query

public <T> void query(Query query,
                      ListCallback<? extends MappedEntity> callback)

Queries the mapped data for all entity that match.

Specified by:
query in interface AppdataStore
Parameters:
query - a specifier for all conditions the entities must match before returned
callback - invoke when the network call completes
